metaDescription: Prestigious 6-bedroom villa in Moraira, Alicante. Sea views, competitively priced at €4.5M. Ideal for discerning buyers seeking exclusive Costa Blanca living.
heroIntro: Welcome to an exceptional opportunity in one of Spain's most coveted coastal destinations. This prestigious 6-bedroom villa in San Jaime, Moraira, represents the pinnacle of sophisticated Mediterranean living on the Costa Blanca. Priced at €4,500,000, this exclusive property is competitively positioned at the Moraira average, offering remarkable value in a market experiencing consistent appreciation. Moraira attracts discerning international buyers seeking a refined alternative to busier coastal resorts—a place where quality of life, privacy, and natural beauty converge seamlessly. With commanding sea views and direct access to some of Spain's most pristine beaches, this villa embodies the luxury lifestyle that has made Moraira increasingly popular among European elite. The property's strategic location provides easy access to world-class amenities, international schools, and exceptional healthcare facilities, making it equally appealing for families and investors seeking long-term appreciation potential.
areaSection: Moraira is an exclusive enclave on the northern Costa Blanca, nestled between Alicante and Valencia provinces. This picturesque coastal town is characterized by dramatic cliff formations, crystalline Mediterranean waters, and a distinctly upmarket atmosphere. The region enjoys over 300 days of sunshine annually, with mild winters and warm summers—ideal for year-round living. Unlike neighboring tourist-focused towns, Moraira maintains an air of exclusive sophistication, attracting affluent European residents who value authenticity over commercialism. The town's geography—perched on elevated terrain with panoramic sea vistas—creates natural privacy and separation from mainstream tourism. Moraira's designation as a Blue Flag beach destination reflects its commitment to environmental standards and marine protection, ensuring long-term preservation of its pristine natural appeal.
lifestyleSection: Living in Moraira offers a distinctly sophisticated Mediterranean experience. The community comprises an upmarket blend of British, German, Dutch, and Spanish residents who share a commitment to quality living and environmental stewardship. Daily life revolves around exceptional beaches—Playa de l'Ampolla, El Portet, and Cala Andrago—accessible within minutes. Fine dining establishments showcase Mediterranean gastronomy, while the Friday weekly market provides authentic local produce and artisanal goods. The expat community is notably refined and cultured, with social activities centered around golf, sailing, and cultural events rather than nightlife. Private healthcare is comprehensive, with English-speaking practitioners and modern facilities readily available. The slower pace of life—free from the frenetic energy of larger resorts—appeals to those seeking privacy and authentic Mediterranean culture. Shopping needs are efficiently met through quality supermarkets, while excellent international schools serve families prioritizing education.
investmentSection: This villa represents a compelling investment opportunity in one of Europe's most sought-after coastal markets. Moraira's real estate market experiences consistent appreciation, with values rising 5% year-on-year—outpacing broader Spanish market trends. The property's pricing at €4,500,000 positions it competitively against regional comparables and represents 25% better value than equivalent properties in Mallorca. Rental income potential is substantial; comparable Moraira villas command €1,600+ weekly during peak season, with off-season lettings providing year-round income streams. The international buyer base—particularly Northern European and British purchasers—ensures consistent demand for luxury rentals. Long-term appreciation potential is enhanced by limited developable coastal land, strict building regulations protecting the environment, and increasing desirability as Mediterranean climate zones shift northward. This villa offers institutional-quality investment characteristics: geographic diversification, tangible asset backing, and multiple exit strategies through owner-occupation or professional management.
conclusion: This exceptional villa represents a rare opportunity to acquire premium Mediterranean real estate in Europe's most discerning coastal destination. The combination of exclusive location, sophisticated design, commanding sea views, and competitive pricing positions this property as an outstanding choice for wealthy international buyers seeking both lifestyle enhancement and investment appreciation. Whether you envision this as your private sanctuary, a distinguished vacation rental asset, or your family's Mediterranean home base, the property delivers on all fronts. The established international community, exceptional amenities, and proven market appreciation trajectory make Moraira an increasingly attractive alternative to congested coastal alternatives. Your exclusive Mediterranean lifestyle awaits.

lifeAndAmenities.intro: Moraira offers exceptional convenience balanced with authentic Mediterranean living. Despite its exclusive character, the town provides comprehensive healthcare, international education, shopping facilities, and cultural amenities. Daily necessities are efficiently accessible, allowing residents to enjoy leisure and family time without compromising on modern conveniences.

healthcare.text: Healthcare in Moraira meets international standards with multiple options available to residents. The Centro de Salud Teulada-Moraira provides primary care and emergency services within 8 minutes. For specialized treatment, Hospital de Dénia—a modern, well-equipped facility—is 25 minutes away and serves the entire region with English-speaking medical professionals. The area hosts several excellent private clinics offering immediate access to specialists, diagnostic imaging, and surgical facilities. Many healthcare providers are accustomed to treating English-speaking patients, with comprehensive private health insurance options available specifically designed for expatriate communities. Preventative care and wellness facilities—including physiotherapy, dental, and cosmetic specialists—are readily accessible.

education.text: Moraira and surrounding areas offer excellent international educational options for families. Lady Elizabeth School, located 15 minutes away, provides British curriculum education from early years through secondary level, attracting expatriate families throughout the region. Laude Newton College (40 minutes) offers comprehensive British-style education with modern facilities and strong university placement records. These schools serve the established international community and maintain rigorous academic standards comparable to leading UK institutions. Bilingual education models incorporating Spanish language instruction ensure children develop proficiency in multiple languages—a valuable advantage for globally mobile families.

shopping.text: Shopping amenities in Moraira cater to discerning residents seeking quality products and authentic local offerings. Major supermarkets—Mercadona, Consum, and Masymas—provide comprehensive grocery selection with international products accommodating diverse dietary preferences. The weekly Friday market in Moraira town center features fresh produce, local delicacies, and artisanal goods from regional producers. For specialty shopping and larger purchases, nearby Dénia offers expanded retail options while maintaining the region's upscale character. Wine selection is exceptional, with numerous bodegas offering Spanish and international wines at superior value compared to Northern European pricing.

transport.text: Transportation in Moraira requires vehicle ownership due to limited public transport infrastructure—a characteristic that reinforces the area's exclusive, car-dependent nature. Alicante-Elche Airport, Spain's fourth-largest international airport, is 70 minutes away via modern motorway, offering direct flights to major European cities. A personal vehicle provides optimal freedom for exploring the broader Costa Blanca region, accessing amenities, and maintaining independence. The road network is well-maintained, and driving times to key destinations are reasonable. Parking is readily available throughout the area, and many residents maintain vehicles suited to coastal driving conditions.
